result.name: seawater-temperature-records-for-the-uk-shelf-17-cefas-esm2-profiler-mini-ctd-logger
result.notes:
This dataset has been extracted as part of an exercise to assemble "all" Cefas 
Temperature Data and publish it in a Data paper. It is one of 17 Cefas data 
sources assembled. ESM2 is a Cefas developed micro logger for applications 
requiring a small low power logger with integrated sensors and battery. It has 
standard sensors for conductivity, temperature, depth, optical backscatter and 
roll & pitch. Data are saved compact flash cards which are easily removed 
for rapid data transfer. It was initially developed to be a handheld profiler 
that could be used from small boats and/or when a conventional large rosette 
couldn't be used. It is now used routinely in place of traditional CTD 
equipment e.g. on SmartBuoy related work and, because it also accommodates 
optional sensors, it is widely used on RV Cefas Endeavour research cruises, 
providing profiles of the water column for plankton and fisheries work. The 
temperature sensor used is an FSI CT model.

organization.name: marine-environmental-data-information-network
organization.title: Marine Environmental Data & Information Network
organization.description: MEDIN is a partnership of UK organisations committed to improving access to marine data. Our partners are both public and private sector.

result.title: Seawater temperature records for the UK Shelf - 17 - Cefas ESM2 Profiler/mini CTD Logger
